text:
Raskolnikov pondered in his room. 

"Razumihin suspects," he thought. 

He grabbed his cap and stepped outside. 

"I must settle Svidrigaïlov," he decided. 

Hate surged in his heart. 

"I could kill either Porfiry or Svidrigaïlov," he mused. 

"We shall see, we shall see." 

The door swung open. 

Porfiry stood there, surprised. 

Raskolnikov froze, then quickly regained his composure. 

He felt no fear, only caution.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels a renewed clarity and determination as he contemplates settling his conflicts with Svidrigaïlov and Porfiry.
